global_flags.description: This is required (unless a preset is specified) and must be first.
= Find problems with variable usage in system files.
(To clean only, use --target clean.)
= Put cmake find in a debug mode.
= Put cmake in a debug mode.
This is useful in debugging failed checks.
named  by  --debugger-pipe  that conforms to the Debug Adapter Protocol specification with the following modifications.
= Legacy pkg-config like mode. Do not use.
= Configure a fresh build tree, removing any existing cache file.
= Generate graphviz of dependencies, see CMakeGraphVizOptions.cmake for more.
= Print help for one keyword and exit.
= Print cmake-commands manual and exit.
= Print all help manuals and exit.
= List help manuals available and exit.
= List modules with help available and exit.
= Print cmake-modules manual and exit.
= Print cmake-policies manual and exit.
= List policies with help available and exit.
= Print cmake-properties manual and exit.
= Print cmake-variables manual and exit.
= Install a CMake-generated project binary tree.
= List available presets.

the available presets of the specified <type>.  Valid values for <type> are configure, build, test, package, or all.  If <type> is omitted, configure is assumed.  The current working directory must contain CMake preset files.
= Prepend log messages with context, if given
= Don't warn about command line options.
= Open generated project in the associated application.

generaâ€ tor  and the build directory, and a list of variables and other arguments to pass to CMake. The current working directory must contain CMake preset files. The CMake GUI can also recognize CMakePresets.json and CMakeUserPresets.json files.  For  full  details  on  these files, see cmake-presets(7).
= Output data for profiling CMake scripts. Supported formats: google-trace
= Select an output path for the profiling data enabled through --profiling-format.
= Dump information about this system.
Multiple targets may be given, separated by spaces.
= Specify toolchain file [CMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE].
= Put cmake in trace mode.
= Put cmake in trace mode with variable expansion.
= Redirect trace output to a file instead of stderr.
= Trace only this CMake file/module. Multiple options allowed.
Behavior is default in CMake >= 3.0.
The output is printed to a named <file> if given.
= Warn about uninitialized values.

nothing.   In CMake versions 3.2 and below this enabled warnings about unused variables.  In CMake versions 3.3 through 3.18 the option was broken.  In CMake 3.19 and above the option has been removed.
= Specify platform name if supported by generator.
= Explicitly specify a build directory.
= Pre-load a script to populate the cache.
= Create or update a cmake cache entry.
= CMake command mode.
= Specify a build system generator.
= List non-advanced cached variables.
View mode only.

the  given cmake file as a script written in the CMake language.  No configure or generate step is performed and the cache is not modified.  If variables are defined using -D, this must be done before the -P argument.
= Explicitly specify a source directory.
= Specify toolset name if supported by generator.
= Remove matching entries from CMake cache.
= Enable deprecation warnings.
Enable developer warnings.
= Make developer warnings errors.
= Suppress deprecation warnings.
= Suppress developer warnings.
= Make developer warnings not errors.
